WorkItem.Description:
In Excel, if one shifts all rows downwards by, say, 1000 rows, the file is not supposed to increase in file size.
 
Therefore it is surprising when a sheet starts with many blank rows, that the output generated by PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007 increases in file size. Moreover, generation time is also high.
 
Let's try to alter just the row height of a row with high row index.
 
Test:
----
$excel = new PHPExcel();
$sheet = $excel->getActiveSheet();
 
$sheet->getRowDimension(60000)->setRowHeight(100); // edited
 
$writer = new PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007($excel);
$writer->save('write.xlsx');
 
Expected result:
----
File size of output is nearly the size of an empty xlsx file ~ 4KB
Quick generation time < 1 seconds
 
Actual result:
----
Huge file size ~ 160KB
Slow generation time ~ 30 seconds
 
Note:
----
This issue is not present with PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5
WorkItem.Summary: Blank rows occupy too much space in file generated by PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007
